text: Nothing scares the billionaire class more than a strong union movement. We will fight for a union for every worker. Join us live in Hillsboro, New Hampshire: https://www.pscp.tv/w/cKrEAjMyNzU3OTl8MU93R1dkRURsRVdKUcfZQRXJetBoJmD7BhFifcBXvFLO1fJHNEl6KO4HXQJS

I've been in plenty of tough battles before—whether it was taking on the political machine here in Newark or working to get historic criminal justice legislation signed into law. Join me if you're ready to bring the fight to Donald Trump: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/cory2020-social-november?refcode=social_TW_20191123
If we could put people on the moon 50 years ago we sure as hell can make automatic voter registration possible nationwide.

It’s never the big battle, the big moment, the big speech, the big election—those alone don’t change things. What changes things is every day, getting up and rendering small acts of service and love beyond what's expected or required, to empower those around you. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKJke_ZX0AIl-NL.jpg

I'm in this fight because I want our kids to have a brighter future. As many Americans gather this week for Thanksgiving, we have to keep in mind those who simply cannot. That includes Americans experiencing homelessness, family members in different countries, service members away from their loved ones, displaced wildfire survivors, and more.

Let’s be clear: Our government criminalizes too many things and sends too many people to jail. In a Warren administration, we will: 

☑️ Repeal the 1994 Crime Bill 
☑️ Legalize marijuana
☑️ Undo the legacy of the War on Drugs
☑️ End cash bail and private prisons

Justice is on the ballot when majority-Black communities in cities across our country lack clean drinking water. 

My Water Justice Act will invest $250 billion over 5 years to repair and replace our drinking water infrastructure.

After I started Back on Track as District Attorney of San Francisco, a lot of people questioned why I was helping young people arrested for first-time drug crimes. I knew in order to stop re-entry we needed to focus on jobs and redemption—not jail. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EKJhGyJXUAEHmoQ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1198625479475048448/vid/320x320/z0H7VATH0ctCGrkO.mp4?tag=13

The retail price of a vital of insulin in the U.S. can cost $300.

In Canada? The same vital costs $32.

When I say health care justice is on the ballot, this is what I mean. As president, I’ll take on Big Pharma and ensure every American can afford the medicine they need.

There have been 2,302 mass shootings in the United States since Sandy Hook. We shouldn't have to live like this. But unless we root out corruption in Washington, the gun lobby will always have a veto on any legislation to end the gun violence epidemic. https://www.vox.com/a/mass-shootings-america-sandy-hook-gun-violence

My LIFT Act would put up to $500 a month back in the pockets of working families. For many, this could be the difference between getting through the end of the month or falling behind.

We need an economy that works for working people. Congress must pass my bill.
@ClintSmithIII Wow, of all the people to get cancelled

A new study estimates that *3.2 million more people* lived in poverty in 2018 than originally reported. It’s becoming more expensive to be poor as the price of housing & other necessities continue to rise.

My LIFT Act would help Americans make ends meet. https://equitablegrowth.org/working-papers/unequal-gains-from-product-innovations/

People went to jail, people were beaten and people died fighting for the right to form a union.

Our job now is not just to stand with the union movement—it is to make it stronger than it has ever been.

In my first term, our goal will be to double union membership in America.

Zero-emission electric buses manufactured in America, with good union wages, local hiring, and apprenticeships to bring marginalized communities into the green economy.
 
Sound radical? It's already happening. This is what a Green New Deal is about. https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2019-11-19/electric-bus-builders-in-l-a-just-joined-a-union-for-oil-workers-with-the-support-of-their-ex-tesla-ceo

California had 15 of its largest wildfires in the past 20 years. Climate change is only making them worse.

I wrote an op-ed about what we can do to prevent these wildfires from becoming our new normal. That includes passing my Wildfire Defense Act. https://www.sfchronicle.com/opinion/openforum/article/Sen-Kamala-Harris-As-climate-crisis-makes-fires-14839788.php#
